discourse_list.title: Bear Stearns Broker-Turned-Whistleblower Loses Bid Against SEC for Reward, D.C. Circuit Rules

content.content: I remember one of the selling points of Dodd-Frank back in or around 2010 was the whistleblower protection. As this case points out, earning that status is not so easy. There is a link in the article to the court’s decision if anyone wants to further get into the legal analysis.    Law & Crime – 30 May 22    Bear Stearns Broker-Turned-Whistleblower Loses Bid Against SEC for Reward,... A federal appeals court has ruled against a whistleblower whose information helped the SEC win both a criminal conviction and a multi-million dollar civil verdict against an investment broker.
Looks like the problem was that the information was submitted before 2010, before the Dodd-Frank whistleblower protections were activated.

Yup. It goes against the spirit of the legislation but I assume this possible retroactive whistle blower status was considered. But who really knows? There were other issues that court avoided discussing because he didn’t make it past the first factor the court used.
